repository.orgName: Bibliothèque nationale de France. Département des Manuscrits

summary.p: This manuscript contains a ballad (ammāṉai) written by the Jesuit missionary Costanzo Giuseppe Beschi (1680-1747) around 1731. The ballad tells the story of the Catholic virgin, martyr and saint Quiteria, called in Tamil Kittēriyammāḷ, of her conversion to Christianity, and her rebellion against her Hindu father. She then flees to the mountains to escape an arranged marriage, and is eventually beheaded by the insulted groom. Beschi brought a statue of this saint to Elākkuṟicci in 1729-30, and initiated her cult: the last chapter of this ballad (putumaik kātai, folio 89r and ff.) talks about the miracles she performed there. Kittēriyammāḷ is still venerated in Tamil Nadu today, especially in the village of Kūttaṉkuḻi.
Description by M. Trento based on the examination of the original manuscript .

filiation.p: This texts exists in multiple manuscript and printed versions (see the bibliography below for some of the printed editions).

finalRubric.term: In-text completion statement at the end of chapters, with total toṭai and intertitle of next chapter.

extent.measure: {1} + 85 + {1} (U1a + U1b + U1c). ― 1 unnumbered folio + 85 numbered folios (foliation 1-102 with folios missing) + 1 guard folio.

supportDesc.foliation: Original Tamil foliation in Tamil numerals for U1b, left margin, starting from folio 1 until folio 102. Several folios are missing: f6, f9-f12, f18, f33, f39-f41, f47, f66-f67, f80, f88, f91, f101.

collation.desc: The manuscript is constituted by a single unit containing the text, with several lacunæ where there are missing folios. The first unnumbered folio contains the title, and the verso of the final guard folio has a the BnF sticker with the current classification (Indien 952).
1 folio = Kittēriyammāḷ Ammāṉai: Front Matter (title, invocation). No foliation.
1 folio = Kittēriyammāḷ Ammāṉai: Colophon. No foliation (possibly lost). Colophon on recto. Verso blank. BnF shelfmark sticker on verso.

supportDesc.condition: Very good state of perservation, despite some wormholes. Some folios cracked.

handNote.desc: Notwithstanding the changes in size (the writing becomes rather small at places) this seems one coherent scribal project by the same hand. The double-curled kompu appears sporadically.

additions.desc: 3 satellite stanzas of invocation on their own independent unfoliated folio. See details below.
Left-marginal, often abbreviated, intertitles. See selection below.

List of versification modes (entitled toṭai viparam; 3 columns): chapter's name, total toṭais per chapter; overall total toṭais; overall total viruttams, tāḻicais, cintus. ― A list (f102v) that counts the modes of versification (toṭai) for each chapter (kātai) of the ballad and for the entire ballad. The figures provided correspond to the number of couplets (the basic prosodic form of the ammāṉai being the two-lines kaṇṇi). Finally, the number of viruttams, tāḻicais, and cintus stanzas are counted. See details below.

origin.origDate: Internally dated to 1825, day 25 of the month of aṟpici. See colophons (U1b, f102r, c2 and U1c, f[1]r).

provenance.p: Owned / Borrowed by Julien Vinson (1843-1926). See handwritten addition, f2v, no. 952 to Cabaton (1912).

acquisition.p: Acquired, June 20th, 1930, from “Paul Vinson”. See BnF, département des Manuscrits, inventaire 3 = Acquisitions: manuscrits et imprimés documentaires, 1894-1950, no. 13591.

listBibl.bibl: Vīrāmāmuṉivar. 1977. Kittēriyammāḷ ammāṉai. Tirunelvēli: Teṉṉintiya caivacittānta nūṟpatippuk kaḻakam.
Amaladass SJ, Anand. 2022 (editor and translator). Vīrāmāmuṉivar iyaṟṟiya Kittēri ammāḷ ammāṉai : mūla nūlum āṅkila moḻipeyarppum. Ceṉṉai: Kiḻakkup patippakam
Arunachalam, M. 1976. Ballad Poetry. Tiruchitrambalam: Gandhi Vidyalayam.

Cabaton, Antoine. 1912. Catalogue sommaire des manuscrits indiens, indo-chinois & malayo-polynésiens. Bibliothèque nationale. Département des manuscrits. Paris: E. Leroux. — See handwritten addition to Cabaton (1912), f3r, no. 952.

encodingDesc.p: General ― Unmarked length of ō and ē supplied. Unmarked puḷḷi supplied. Conjectural reading (text unclear) between parentheses. Supplied reading (text lost) between square brackets. Alternative readings separated by slash. In transliteration ― Unmarked elided overshort u supplied as an apostrophe. Uppercase for initial vowels. Symbols between curly brackets. Abbreviations ― c = column; f = folio; lf = library foliation; lm = left margin; r = recto; rm = right margin; u / U followed by a number = unit (codicological and/or textual); v = verso.

revisionDesc.change: Record created by Margherita TRENTO with funding from the European Union's Horizon 2020 research and innovation programme under the Marie Skłodowska-Curie grant agreement no. 840879.
Converted to TEI by Charles LI.
Revised and enlarged by Emmanuel FRANCIS. Version 1 (January 2023).

ḷiṉai vāṉkati nāṉ peṟac ceyvāyē == pompē == 6 === This last folio contains some stanzas from the anupallavi of a musical composition, a cintu, associated with the Kittēriyammāḷ Ammāṉai. The entirety of the composition is available in the most recent printed edition of this ballad (Amaladass 2022).
